intro: Metasequoia, commonly known as the dawn redwood, is a deciduous conifer native to China. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and feathery, needle-like leaves that turn red in the fall. The plant produces small, cone-like structures that contain seeds, typical of coniferous trees. Metasequoia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riparian zones. Due to its ancient lineage, it is considered a living fossil, having been thought extinct until rediscovered in the 20th century.
